Additionally, some parameters may influence other related parameters (e.g., CBODN might affect CNOD due to biochemical processes). However, to avoid overfitting and cycles, we will only include direct causal relationships that align with domain knowledge and temporal ordering. For example, a measurement at _12_00 may directly influence the same parameter at _12_15, but not at _12_45 directly, unless there is a clear intermediate step. We will also include relationships where one parameter may influence another due to known biochemical interactions (e.g., CBODN influencing CNOD).
